reviewText:
Video Featuring Crucial Advice For New Parents From The American Academy Of Pediatrics.

From The Notes On The Box:

"Health Answers For Parents: Caring For Your Newborn gives you answers to the common questions and issues that come up during the first few months with your new baby. Light-hearted vignettes present topics such as crying, feeding, and bathing in a manner all parents can relate to. Your pediatric team then addresses these issues using a very personal, one-on-one approach. Our goal is to give you the information you need to care for your new baby confidently."

"Caring for Your Newborn covers:

# Crying,

# Feeding,

# Sleep,

# Colds and Fever,

# Colic,

# Skin Care,

# Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS),

# Immunizations,

# Bowel Movements and

# Automobile Safety."

"Your pediatric team of experts includes: Rosario Gonzalez-DeRivas, MD, FAAP, associate professor of pediatrics at University of Puerto Rico, San Juan, Puerto Rico; Robert Johnson, MD, FAAP, professor of pediatrics and clinical psychiatry at the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey; Steven Shelov, MD, FAAP, chairman of pediatrics at Maimonides Medical Center in New York and editor-in-chief of Caring for Your Baby and Young Child: Ages Birth to 5; Loraine Stern, MD, FAAP, associate clinical professor of pediatrics at University of California, Los Angeles."

"Health Answers for Parents: Caring for Your Newborn is a joint production of the American Academy of Pediatrics and the Orbis Broadcast Group."

"The American Academy of Pediatrics is an organization of 53,000 primary care pediatricians, pediatric medical subspecialists, and pediatric surgical specialists dedicated to the health, safety, and well-being of infants, children, adolescents, and young adults."
